reviews.title: Magic Summer 2024
text: Great atmosphere and lively stage! Magic Summer Tour with NKOTB, Paula Adbul and DJ Jazzy Jeff!  The place was electric and easy access to everything.

reviews.title: Just ok
text: Venue itself is good, however leaving is a bit of a nightmare, not much room and your corralled into a narrow leaving path.  Parking when there is something going on at Exhibition place (which is in same area) is non existent closeby.

reviews.title: Great venue but canâ€™t be trusted.
text: I do love this venue and it was a great show (NKOTB & Paula Abdul) however I bought a $62 tshirt and when I checked my account the next day I noticed I was actually charged $140 for it. Since then I have tried to speak with someone at Budweiser Stage but have yet to hear back. When discussing with friends I learned that this is pretty common practice there. As they are a no cash venue they often just pass the debit/cc machine with the tap portion and donâ€™t show you the total so I strongly urge you to double check every transaction.

reviews.title: Bush Loaded Tour!!!
text: Our first visit to Budweiser stage was an amazing one thanks to Bush and special guests. This venue has an amazing atmosphere and the sound quality was really good! Beer was over priced as usual but if you like rock n roll Iâ€™d recommend this place for a great outdoor experience.

reviews.title: Kids on the block concert
text: Fun evening with friends. Washrooms were cleaned and the line ups moved quite quickly. The venue is steps away from the CNE, so itâ€™s easy to access through Go train Exhibition stop. They also gives you access to plenty of snacks options before the stadium. Remember that backpacks over 12 inches are not allowed inside the stadium.

reviews.title: My favourite summer venue for a concert during nice weather!
text: Excellent venue on a warm summer night is the best concert venue in Toronto overlooking the city and lake. If you have access visit the American Express VIP lounge

reviews.title: US ruined this venue. DO NOT GO TO BUDWEISER STAGE
text: used to be the nicest place in TO for a concert...until the US purchased it. now i dread going there and even debate passing on my favourite artists
1) there are now fewer and less diverse food trucks, all of which are more expensive
2) there is now less merch, all of which is more expensive
3) a sizeable area meant for those vendors, contests, games, events etc. has been relegated to porta poties
4) prices have bee nraised to 16.50 before tax for a single beer. for reference thats how much the lcbo charges for 6
5) the lawns are never maintained anymore. what was once nice grass is now consistently mud, dirt, woodchips
6) they no longer allow you to hang out, buy merch or food after the show and immeidately rush you out

7) bag policy has gotten much more strict. the  max size limit is too small to even hold a  towel, unless you purvhase one of their clear bags, which is likely to get you mugged after the show. alternatively if you do bring a bag, they force you to pay for lockers of which there arent that many of and there is only one line so you're waiting even longer
8) they do nothing to notify or accomodate people for the massive inconveneince that is actually getting to the venue due to the honda indies

worst of all (and i've seen this is a common complaint), their "customer service" is terrible and near non existent.  went to complain the other night that they should have made a public annoucnement when a band went on early as we were stuck in line waiting for food/ drinks we had already paid for resulting in missing the first few songs. they basically said sorry not sorry since its the band who decides when to go on, not them. when i told them thats not an acceptable answer since even if the band decides, as they venue they are responsible and they have more than enough employees for one to go up to the mic and let people know...they then tried to gaslight me saying i should have known when buying the tickets that times are subject to change without notice and its my fault if i didnt read the TOC.  i responded saying thats only true in the event of a delay...they left me on "seen", even after i tried to follow up giving them the benefit of the doubt in case they just forgot to respond. finally i said "so just to recap, first you refuse to accept any responsibility. then you fully blame the band and me as a customer...and now you're ghosting me for calling you out on it?"... of cource i was once again left on "seen"

reviews.title: First visit to Budweiser Stage Toronto
text: Attended our first concert at Budweiser Stage in Toronto to see Yacht Rock Review, REO Speedwagon and Train on July 20, 2024. We took the GO train from Union station to the Exhibition GO stop, about a 10 minute ride. Arrived early and went through the Security gate, check before going on what you are allowed to bring in with you. We bought our tickets off of Groupon for the concert and they worked well, I just scanned the Groupon voucher off of my phone on the way in. Once inside there are a lot of food and drink stands on your way into the concert seating area. The concert started on time and went from 6:25pm to 11:00pm. We had originally bought lawn seating but were upgraded to seats under the roof. So happy we got these as it was standing room only on the lawn. Sound was very good and they had some large screens to watch on each side of the stage. During the break between bands there was a significant lineup for the women's washroom at the front entrance, but people did not know that there are other washrooms near the  back of the park also. The concert venue did do an announcement that helped a lot, but just be aware. The PRO's: The concert went off on time and sound/lighting was excellent. The large screens on either side of the stage helped out a lot when people were standing up for some songs. Definitely consider taking public transit to and from the event. Lots of people around to help with any questions while there. CONS: The drink and food prices were too expensive. Also the bicycle rick shaw's at the exit were also expensive and pricing did not seem to be regulated at all, some people bartering on the spot. We opted to walk to the Exhibition GO station instead. Overall a very positive experience and we will be back for more concerts.

reviews.title: Budweiser Low Fi
text: Attended the Counting Crows/Santana concert last night at the Budweiser Stage. The sound was awful. The high end was distorted and grating to the ear. Midrange was lacking. Clarity was absent. The bottom end was excellent. Great show, but it was disappointing that the mix degraded the sound. Experienced the same sound at an outdoor concert a few years ago at Port Credit. I assume the sound is controlled by venue personnel. The bands should have the control of their sound. I read a number of prior reviews complaining about the Budweiser sound. Would love to hear from others who attended last night.

reviews.title: Awesome venue
text: Really enjoyed the concert.  LONG walk from where Uber dropped us to our seats. Absolute miracle that we found Uber driver after concert.  Taxi drivers trying to charge triple the Uber fees. Would be nice if everyone wasnt filtered after concert like sheep into ONE walkway. And if the cab/ uber drop off was more organized and regulated.  Alsoâ€¦..INSANE prices for food & drinks.  But, it is a cool venue to see a band !

reviews.title: Imposible parking!
text: We can't see the concert!!!... The parking lot and all the parking lots around are full... Bad experience!

reviews.title: Great Accessibility Services
text: Recently flew from Calgary for the EWF and Santana concert. I was somewhat anxious I had tweaked my knee, and was slowly, with a cane. As it was our first visit I was anxious about the amount of walking I would need to do. It was a delightful surprise when I was offered a wheelchair just after entering. We were taken to our seats, and picked up, at the end of the show.
The venue itself was amazing.

reviews.title: Stay off the Lawn!
text: Actual Santana concert was great....excellent sound and lighting.

I have been to this venue many times and never found it as jam packed as it was for this concert. Show started a little after 7pm and by the time E,W & F ended at 8:30pm, there were still people arriving. It was as if the lawn was oversold, people were standing in all the concrete aisles.
The entrance and exiting process is very, very slow and completely disorganized.
The prices for food outside the actual amphitheater are very expensive and most do not accept cash, so be forewarned.

Unfortunately, we were n the lawn and found a large number of people had chairs, blocking the views of those of us sitting on the lawn. If Budweiser Stage (Live Nation) want to improve things then they need to designate certain areas for chairs so the rest of the lawn patrons don't have to deal with these people.
And of course, washrooms are limited - from the lawn you can spend the whole intermission searching and lining up for a washroom.
Hint - to enjoy the show, stay away from the lawn area,

reviews.title: Santana concert A+
text: Amazing concerts by Earth, Wind and Fire and of course the headliner Santana! I saw Carlos the last time he was here and this time was even better! Concert A+
Budweiser stage had poor entry and exit protocols. Huge unsafe crowding on exit due to few major exits.  Seating was great and lots of vendors.

reviews.title: Budweiser Stage
text: I saw Santana with Earth, Wind and Fire opening for them.  The theatre was covered and it had great acoustics.  The sound was amazing. It is a great place for a summer concert.

reviews.title: Terrible.
text: Santana concert on August 07, 2022. We arrived at the gate just before 5:30pm. There was already a huge line up. By the time we got in it was well pass 7:00pm. Missed most of the opening act (Earth, Wind and Fire). Will I be going again? I don't think so.

reviews.title: To Much Smoking
text: If you happen to get lawn seats at Budweiser Stage be prepared to put up with the stench of pot smoke and cigarette smoke during the performance.  It was really bad and ruined the experience for our group.

reviews.title: Fun times
text: Beautiful outdoor venue along lake Ontario at Ontario Place. Sound quality was excellent  and of course Maroon 5 put on a fantastic show

reviews.title: Not the experience I had hoped for - 1st large venue concert after pandemic
text: Blue Rodeo Aug 28,2021- mask protocols were not enforced or followed. There was smoking within the venue.  While the performances were great, the sound system plotted instruments against vocals the vocals tended to lose.  Volume was high but clarity was low. Talking and smoking during the performances show no respect for the artists or other fans.  Late start could be accounted for as a first concert in a while, but updates could have been provided.
While performances were great, i woke up the next morning wondering if I should go for a COVID test. Too soon for a concert without social distancing since mask protocols were not observed.

reviews.title: Blow Rodeo storm event
text: The people who put this on should be embarrassed or in jail. Maybe both.

We arrived well with in time but they closed the doors and left hundreds of people exposed to rain and serious lightning. We waited a long time then they started to process people into the venue. There was no organization just a huge crowd at the gate. Not exactly Covid friendly.
Terrible experience. The show was not that great.

reviews.title: Great venue
text: Wow what a great venue, Zac Brown Band was incredible, travelled from Australia to see the concert and it was worth every minute. Everyone at the venue was super friendly and helpful

reviews.title: Gross!
text: I have been going to this venue for over 30 years and it use to be one of my all time favourite venues for live music but my recent visit was for Zac Brown Band and it was awful.

There is no organization upon arrival at this venue. They have you line up like cattle in non existent lines as you watch so many people bud into line in front of you. Everybody is just jammed together.
Upon entry there are line ups everywhere for food, merch and alcohol.  If you just want to get inside the venue, good luck! Youâ€™re literally struggling thru all these lines and crowds.

But the absolute worst are the bathrooms!! Public health needs to do an audit of this place! Just disgusting! Porta potty after porta potty in summer heat! Hand washing area ran out of water and soap! Seriously! So unhygienic!  There is another area for indoor washroom but line up was insane.

We had general admission tickets which I use to love sitting on the grass enjoying the concert but will never do again because of all the drunkards falling into us and ultimately pushing us out of our area.
We ended up leaving before the concert finished because we didnâ€™t want to have to deal with anymore unorganized crowds at this place.

reviews.title: Budweiser Stage Rocks
text: Concert venue was as always superb. It was hotter than Hades but TO can't be blamed for that. Excellent sound quality and seats. Went to see Robert Plant and Alison Krauss and was gifted with a musical education and stellar performance. Great crowd, friendly atmosphere and would/will gladly go again to this venue. Uber service afterward was top shelf. No issues. Great time had by all.

reviews.title: Good Music, Horribly Organized
text: This is my second review of the Budweiser Stage and unfortunately I am having to downgrade my previous experience. The venue is still very good for live music, but the amenities have gotten worse.

First, there are not enough washrooms and the washrooms that are there are absolutely disgusting. Thank goodness Clorox was a sponsor and handing out packages of disinfectant wipes! This coming season I hope the operations management plans to staff attendants to keep the washrooms in order.

Second, exiting is treacherous. The crowd is so tight everyone is basically walking on each other towards the exit. I hope there is never an instance where one drunken idiot  doesn't take to kindly getting bumped by another person. Someone will get hurt or worse in a stampede.

Third, there is no real control of tickets holders. Once the main act comes on stage people from the back sections fill the aisles in the lower sections. What is the point have having people buy tickets when it essentially becomes a free for all? Either enforce the ticket sections or remove all the seats and make the entire venue General Admin.

reviews.title: Great venue
text: Went for a concert to end out vacation. What a great venue. Part covered with an open plan feel it was perfect for a vacation convert. Loved the venue and weather cooperated well. Drinks are expensive at $12 for 2 waters but they are always expensive in these places so no worse than other venues

reviews.title: Great venue accept accessibility is not.
text: Make sure you get near the exit when encore plays or you will be in a painful slow moving crowd to get out   There is only one entrance/exit . If your claustrophobic best to wait until crowd clears. It borders on dangerous!

reviews.title: Concert fans .
text: Small washrooms for such a big venue. The standing area for a concert is too big, that puts people who paid for seats closer to the stage too far away.

reviews.title: Terrible venue! Avoid
text: Hard to get to and terrible acoustics once youâ€™re inside. I went through all areas and the sound was low fidelity all around, though slightly better when directly in front of a speaker. Try to see shows anywhere else

reviews.title: Not the biggest fan of the Budweiser Stage
text: I recently saw a concert at the Budweiser Stage and, although I thoroughly enjoyed the concert, the same could not be said about the venue.

I will preface this by saying that it was my first time at this venue, and it was during a long weekend, so there were several other events happening nearby at the same time. It's possible that had the concert happened on a regular Saturday night, my impression could have been different. With that in mind...

I found the Budweiser Stage to just be kind of meh. I enjoyed the fact that it's on the water - so it's got a nice backdrop - and the bathrooms were clean, which is also a big plus. I found the staff to be helpful in directing me to my seat, which was also great!

Unfortunatley, however, parking was very difficult to find, and also expensive. The way the food vendors(?) were laid out was an interesting concept, but that area needed more seating to be enjoyable. I also found it difficult to find something aside from water or alcohol to drink.

What really coloured my perception of the venue was the following: During the last song before the band's encore, someone random came in and sat down in the row in front of me that had several unoccupied seats in it. He was wearing a high-vis vest as though he blonged at the venue in some way, but he was acting very sketchy. He kept trying to offer me some kind of snack, which was weird enough, but he was being over-the-top for the kind of music that was playing. He kept digging in his backpack, and putting on what looked to be old/used wristbands from past shows. Then at one point "dropped" something that rolled down to the rows in front of his. He immediatley went after whatever it was, but was under the seats for a suspiciously long time, so I went to security to alert them to this guy, and sure enough - he had been trying to swipe people's stuff! I've never been more glad to listen to my gut instinct!

So because the venue is open air, I suspect this kind of thing is not uncommon, unfortunatley. If you happen to be going to a show here, make sure you bring a small bag that you can keep on your person, just in case more folks like this guy are lurking around.

I also found leaving the venue once the show was over, to be a bit frustrating because of all of the bottlenecks happening. All in all though, not the worst venue, but also not the best. I'd go back to see my favourite band play, but that's about it.

reviews.title: Great for music, not good for food
text: Great venue to watch a concert.  about 15K capacity and very good sound from all around.  You have to get there early to get parking but there is parking at ex grounds just need to walk over the bridge.  Beer is incredibly overpriced and food is not good.. other than that.. great place for concerts.

reviews.title: Loving the Budweiser Stage & 21 Savage Show!
text: Whether you're a seasoned concertgoer or a first-time attendee, I highly recommend the Budweiser Stage for your next live music experience. Its waterfront setting, state-of-the-art facilities, and unparalleled ambiance were all good times!

reviews.title: Good place for concerts
text: Great venue, well organized except for the vendor stands for merchandise, it was such a mess that you could not pass through to the actual entrance of the stage. Bathrooms were cleaned, food and drinks a bit expensive. Getting a taxi was messy but ok not  venue's fault.

reviews.title: Budweiser Stage is the worst managed concert venue in Toronto
text: Avoid the Budweiser Stage venue. I have been to concerts at Rogers Centre, Scotia Place Arena, Massey Hall, and Roy Thomson Hall and they are excellent places to watch a concert. Five Stars for them.

The worst managed is the Budweiser Stage at Ontario Place. Live Nation runs the events. Though the acts are great, the management of Budweiser Stage fails miserably at running the place. Security lets people drink and smoke in their seats and took no action to implement the No Smoking By-Laws. Drunks roam freely from beer dispensaries staggering back to their seats.

The facility was not designed to hold large crowds of 10,000 or so. They cram customers tightly into the Budweiser Stage. You could be seated next to a drunk or a chain smoker. But have no options to correct the situation.
Security is very inconsistent. For example, at the July 8th Billy Talent Concert security let people stand in the passageways leading to the seats, the concessions, and the washrooms.

I stood for 90 minutes along with a large crowd for the Cancer Bats and Cypress Hill performances. I thought it was OK to stand there. Security let them stand there. People were doing it right from the start.

If it wasn't OK why didn't security enforce the rules from the start? When the security guards started to disperse the crowd just before the Billy Talent act, I objected and expressed my dissatisfaction with the way customers were treated.

What does he do? Instead of referring my complaint to his manager or customer service, he threw me out for trespassing....way to go Live Nation. Your treatment of customers and the unwelcoming nature of your operations is a guaranteed way of losing customers.

By the way, the bands were great, though I was tossed out before Billy Talent the feature took to the stage. My son tells me that History, venue owned by Drake in the Beaches is a great place to watch bands. He saw Protest the Hero there last week. There are no seats. People can stand. Security is subtle but effective.

reviews.title: Memorable
text: Hozier performed here, what an amazing and memorable show. I prefer seated concerts, but on the off chance, I booked floor seats in the pit for this particular performance. It has been over a decade since I have been to Budweiser, when I last went it was still the Molson Amphitheatre. Hozier, his band, and the opening act Madison Cunningham both have terrific vocals and are excellent live.  His voice is everything you would expect and more. It was totally worth it to see him perform in person and in his prime. Fantastic evening!

reviews.title: Great venue
text: Best venue for concerts - sound is amazing. Been to many concerts here and much better than Scotia Bank Arena. Great place to spend summers outdoors listening to music.
Been to The Cure, Florence and the Machine 3 times, Counting Crows etc.

reviews.title: Good night out
text: Always a great time to experience live music and get out of the house. Distance is over 100km from home but worth the drive .

reviews.title: Sting and Tears for fears...poor sound.
text: Saw Sting last night, great performance terrible sound.Thete were four of us and no one could hear what Sting said each time he spoke.We were third row, section 301.We also saw Tears for fears a couple of months ago and we had exactly the same sound experience.We could not hear what the band said when they each spoke,it was all muffled....Beware,it's disappointing to not be able to hear the band speak to the audience...so we don't know what was said ðŸ˜ž.

reviews.title: Smaller venue but awesome concert experience!
text: Went to see Sting in concert, first time at Budweiser stage. The venue is easy to get to via TTC, with a short walk to the entrance. This is a smaller venue, so there aren't the huge crowds entering or exiting. There is stadium type seating, some of which is partly covered by a roof (the sides are partially open too), although standard width the seats have a generous amount of room in front, so people could easily get by, without you needing to stand up. There's a grassed area at the back of the venue, where you can bring your lawn chairs, although furthest distance from stage. There are lots of alcohol vendors and a few food places, they stop serving drinks at 10pm, although some of the food places were open at the end of the concert. The view of the stage was awesome in the 200 section, sound system was great.  There was some on site parking, not sure of the cost, but it seemed to be chaotic on the way out, you exit onto Lake Shore, so it is very busy. There were a few taxi's and rickshaws waiting directly at the entrance, but if you order a taxi, they are supposed to pick you up on Lakeshore. Make sure you confirm with the taxi company/uber exactly where they are going to pick you up, it took 10 minutes to find mine. I much preferred this venue to any other I have attended, just because it was a smaller crowd and had a great view of the stage.

reviews.title: Lawn seat, overpriced, rules not enforced
text: Overall a good experience.
Great opener and amazing main act !
Lawn seating had a decent view, and sound was good. Even the weather cooperated for us.  Bring a blanket to sit on, or a LOW beach chair.
$4 for a CAN of pop was excessive, and food even more so.  Be prepared for the expensive and no-cash venues.

Security does not enforce the venue rules well or equally - many large lawn chairs on the hill, lots of backpacks and outside food but also saw much confiscated upon entry.   You may or may not have been allowed to bring in an empty bottle for water.
Signs and rules say NO SMOKING but the hill had wafts of pot smoke all night :(
Exiting was the worst part - one narrow way out, with thousands of people.

reviews.title: Lawn chairs allowed, overpriced drinks!
text: Went to a concert at the Budweiser stage, had GA lawn tickets.  Most people had blankets and there were some with low profile camp chairs.  It's not super clear on the venue site if camp chairs are aloud, we brought our small ones and had no problem.  During the show everyone stood up anyways.
Drinks were WAY overpriced! $15 + tip for a 500ml can of Nutrl or Beer.  Parking was $35.   The show was great!
